body:
Some findings:

when running locally on a single machine, I haven't been able to reproduce this. I am able to reproduce the behavior when two C# qps workers are running on 2 separate GCE VMs.

Also, I've been able to reproduce with both secure and insecure connections.

When running linux c++ client against a C# windows server on GCE, the QPS is very low.

```
RUNNING SCENARIO: csharp_protobuf_async_unary_ping_pong
I1206 13:09:23.141579320    2395 ev_epoll_linux.c:91]        epoll engine will be using signal: 40
D1206 13:09:23.141647487    2395 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
D1206 13:09:23.148363046    2395 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
I1206 13:09:23.152677415    2395 driver.cc:268]              Starting server on grpc-performance-windows1:30000 (worker #0)
D1206 13:09:23.152716835    2395 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
I1206 13:09:23.329526240    2395 driver.cc:336]              Starting client on jtattermusch-performance-test:30000 (worker #1)
D1206 13:09:23.329600429    2395 driver.cc:375]              Client 0 gets 1 channels
I1206 13:09:23.333675700    2395 driver.cc:396]              Initiating
I1206 13:09:23.334175030    2395 driver.cc:417]              Warming up
I1206 13:09:24.334327205    2395 driver.cc:423]              Starting
I1206 13:09:24.337219954    2395 driver.cc:450]              Running
I1206 13:09:29.334380256    2395 driver.cc:464]              Finishing clients
I1206 13:09:29.335075355    2395 driver.cc:478]              Received final status from client 0
I1206 13:09:29.339197497    2395 driver.cc:510]              Finishing servers
I1206 13:09:29.339570921    2395 driver.cc:524]              Received final status from server 0
I1206 13:09:29.379025406    2395 report.cc:81]               QPS: 25.0
I1206 13:09:29.379166086    2395 report.cc:91]               QPS: 25.0 (inf/server core)
I1206 13:09:29.379175999    2395 report.cc:96]               Latencies (50/90/95/99/99.9%-ile): 40102.6/40681.9/41732.8/42351.3/43862.6 us
I1206 13:09:29.379185649    2395 report.cc:106]              Server system time: 0.00%
I1206 13:09:29.379192006    2395 report.cc:108]              Server user time:   0.00%
I1206 13:09:29.379199613    2395 report.cc:110]              Client system time: 0.32%
I1206 13:09:29.379206300    2395 report.cc:112]              Client user time:   0.32%
I1206 13:09:29.379212465    2395 report.cc:117]              Server CPU usage: 0.00%
```

on the other hand, if windows GCE C# client speaks to a linux c++ server, the QPS seems normal.
```
RUNNING SCENARIO: csharp_protobuf_async_unary_ping_pong
I1206 13:17:40.329003780    2566 ev_epoll_linux.c:91]        epoll engine will be using signal: 40
D1206 13:17:40.329081127    2566 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
D1206 13:17:40.334541158    2566 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
I1206 13:17:40.341033841    2566 driver.cc:268]              Starting server on jtattermusch-performance-test:30000 (worker #0)
D1206 13:17:40.341089185    2566 ev_posix.c:105]             Using polling engine: epoll
I1206 13:17:40.714166001    2566 driver.cc:336]              Starting client on grpc-performance-windows1:30000 (worker #1)
D1206 13:17:40.714233261    2566 driver.cc:375]              Client 0 gets 1 channels
I1206 13:17:40.784031175    2566 driver.cc:396]              Initiating
I1206 13:17:40.785508359    2566 driver.cc:417]              Warming up
I1206 13:17:41.785640614    2566 driver.cc:423]              Starting
I1206 13:17:41.786544575    2566 driver.cc:450]              Running
I1206 13:17:46.785680979    2566 driver.cc:464]              Finishing clients
I1206 13:17:46.786581908    2566 driver.cc:478]              Received final status from client 0
I1206 13:17:46.826886925    2566 driver.cc:510]              Finishing servers
I1206 13:17:46.827358298    2566 driver.cc:524]              Received final status from server 0
I1206 13:17:47.061780916    2566 report.cc:81]               QPS: 3269.6
I1206 13:17:47.061831816    2566 report.cc:91]               QPS: 3269.6 (408.7/server core)
I1206 13:17:47.061839854    2566 report.cc:96]               Latencies (50/90/95/99/99.9%-ile): 290.6/376.1/410.2/509.7/1698.0 us
I1206 13:17:47.061843434    2566 report.cc:106]              Server system time: 8.09%
I1206 13:17:47.061846654    2566 report.cc:108]              Server user time:   11.27%
I1206 13:17:47.061849565    2566 report.cc:110]              Client system time: 0.00%
I1206 13:17:47.061859377    2566 report.cc:112]              Client user time:   0.00%
I1206 13:17:47.061865250    2566 report.cc:117]              Server CPU usage: 2.56%
```

Logs from a windows server (using GPR_CLOCK_PRECISE timestamps):

```
I0101 00:00:15.367518699  3820 server.c:1416] grpc_server_request_call(server=00000000113F2300, call=000000001382BAD0, details=000000001382BAD8, initial_metadata=000000001382BB18, cq_bound_to_call=0000000000196650, cq_for_notification=0000000000196650, tag=000000001382BAD0)
I0101 00:00:15.367537299  3820 completion_queue.c:386] grpc_completion_queue_next(cc=0000000000196650, deadline=gpr_timespec { tv_sec: 9223372036854775807, tv_nsec: 0, clock_type: 1 }, reserved=0000000000000000)
I0101 00:00:15.406584699  1664 call.c:1355] ops[0]: RECV_INITIAL_METADATA ptr=00000000114414E8
D0101 00:00:15.406621499  1664 chttp2_transport.c:1211] perform_stream_op[s=0000000011441A88/23]: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA
I0101 00:00:15.406631499  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: :scheme: http
I0101 00:00:15.406638499  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: :method: POST
I0101 00:00:15.406643899  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: :path: /grpc.testing.BenchmarkService/UnaryCall
I0101 00:00:15.406649099  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: :authority: grpc-performance-windows1:51068
I0101 00:00:15.406653899  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: grpc-encoding: identity
I0101 00:00:15.406658499  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: grpc-accept-encoding: identity,deflate,gzip
I0101 00:00:15.406663099  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: te: trailers
I0101 00:00:15.406668199  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: content-type: application/grpc
I0101 00:00:15.406678299  1664 parsing.c:456] HTTP:23:HDR:SVR: user-agent: grpc-c++/1.1.0-dev grpc-c/2.0.0-dev (linux; chttp2; good)
D0101 00:00:15.406718599  1664 chttp2_transport.c:999] perform_stream_op_locked: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA; on_complete = 0000000011440A78
D0101 00:00:15.406732399  1664 chttp2_transport.c:861] complete_closure_step: 0000000011440A78 refs=0 flags=0x0000 desc=op->on_complete err="No Error"
I0101 00:00:15.406746599  1664 completion_queue.c:251] grpc_cq_end_op(exec_ctx=000000000E99F2E0, cc=0000000000196650, tag=000000001382BAD0, error="No Error", done=000007FEF43D7800, done_arg=00000000133E9540, storage=00000000133E9570)
I0101 00:00:15.406773599  3820 completion_queue.c:471] RETURN_EVENT[0000000000196650]: OP_COMPLETE: tag:000000001382BAD0 OK
```

After a call is requested on the server (tag 1382BAD0), there's a ~40ms delay before the call is actually received (cq_next returns).
@ctiller do you have any ideas what could be the problem? It looks like a kick is missing somewhere?

Similar log with GPRC_TRACE=all
```
I0101 00:00:11.132167299  3456 server.c:1416] grpc_server_request_call(server=000000000FDCC500, call=0000000013F0B8E0, details=0000000013F0B8E8, initial_metadata=0000000013F0B928, cq_bound_to_call=000000000D7CBDF0, cq_for_notification=000000000D7CBDF0, tag=0000000013F0B8E0)
I0101 00:00:11.132181899  3456 completion_queue.c:386] grpc_completion_queue_next(cc=000000000D7CBDF0, deadline=gpr_timespec { tv_sec: 9223372036854775807, tv_nsec: 0, clock_type: 1 }, reserved=0000000000000000)
D0101 00:00:11.170780899  3136 combiner.c:158] C:000000000D8018C0 grpc_combiner_execute c=000000001223BF98 cov=0 last=1
D0101 00:00:11.172341299  3136 combiner.c:211] C:000000000D8018C0 grpc_combiner_continue_exec_ctx workqueue=0000000000000000 is_covered_by_pofller=(final=0 elems=0)->0 exec_ctx_ready_to_finish=0 time_to_execute_final_list=0
D0101 00:00:11.172356599  3136 combiner.c:230] C:000000000D8018C0 maybe_finish_one n=000000001223BF98
I0101 00:00:11.172383399  3136 call.c:1355] ops[0]: RECV_INITIAL_METADATA ptr=0000000012240BB8
I0101 00:00:11.172393299  3136 server.c:800] OP[server:0000000012240AB0]: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA
I0101 00:00:11.172399499  3136 http_server_filter.c:322] OP[http-server:0000000012240AC8]: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA
I0101 00:00:11.172405999  3136 connected_channel.c:70] OP[connected:0000000012240B28]: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA
D0101 00:00:11.172412800  3136 chttp2_transport.c:1211] perform_stream_op[s=0000000012241158/7]: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA
D0101 00:00:11.172419200  3136 combiner.c:158] C:000000000D8018C0 grpc_combiner_execute c=0000000012240210 cov=0 last=3
I0101 00:00:11.172428199  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: :scheme: http
I0101 00:00:11.172434799  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: :method: POST
I0101 00:00:11.172440099  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: :path: /grpc.testing.BenchmarkService/UnaryCall
I0101 00:00:11.172444999  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: :authority: grpc-performance-windows1:51421
I0101 00:00:11.172449999  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: grpc-encoding: identity
I0101 00:00:11.172454499  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: grpc-accept-encoding: identity,deflate,gzip
I0101 00:00:11.172458899  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: te: trailers
I0101 00:00:11.172463699  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: content-type: application/grpc
I0101 00:00:11.172469200  3136 parsing.c:456] HTTP:7:HDR:SVR: user-agent: grpc-c++/1.1.0-dev grpc-c/2.0.0-dev (linux; chttp2; good)
D0101 00:00:11.172487000  3136 frame_window_update.c:115] FLOW    parse: server CREDIT                                        STREAM[7]:outgoing_window    65535 by                                                  received_update    65535 giving 131070
D0101 00:00:11.172498899  3136 parsing.c:379] FLOW    parse: server DEBIT                                         TRANSPORT:incoming_window  1048555 by                                              incoming_frame_size        7 giving 1048548
D0101 00:00:11.172509699  3136 parsing.c:393] FLOW    parse: server DEBIT                                         STREAM[7]:incoming_window    65535 by                                              incoming_frame_size        7 giving 65528
D0101 00:00:11.172539999  3136 combiner.c:275] C:000000000D8018C0 finish old_state=5
D0101 00:00:11.172549399  3136 combiner.c:211] C:000000000D8018C0 grpc_combiner_continue_exec_ctx workqueue=0000000000000000 is_covered_by_poller=(final=0 elems=0)->0 exec_ctx_ready_to_finish=0 time_to_execute_final_list=0
D0101 00:00:11.172555400  3136 combiner.c:230] C:000000000D8018C0 maybe_finish_one n=0000000012240210
D0101 00:00:11.172561899  3136 chttp2_transport.c:999] perform_stream_op_locked: [UNCOVERED] RECV_INITIAL_METADATA; on_complete = 0000000012240148
D0101 00:00:11.172573999  3136 chttp2_transport.c:861] complete_closure_step: 0000000012240148 refs=0 flags=0x0000 desc=op->on_complete err="No Error"
I0101 00:00:11.172586899  3136 completion_queue.c:251] grpc_cq_end_op(exec_ctx=000000000EB1F070, cc=000000000D7CBDF0, tag=0000000013F0B8E0, error="No Error", done=000007FEF3437800, done_arg=0000000013B09540, storage=0000000013B09570)
D0101 00:00:11.172596399  3136 combiner.c:275] C:000000000D8018C0 finish old_state=3
I0101 00:00:11.172616099  3456 completion_queue.c:471] RETURN_EVENT[000000000D7CBDF0]: OP_COMPLETE: tag:0000000013F0B8E0 OK
```

Just a heads up that I'd love to look at this, but there's a very low
chance that it gets to be something I can spend time on before January.

On Thu, Dec 8, 2016, 6:53 AM Jan Tattermusch <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

>
>
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/8806#issuecomment-265758885>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJpudXXPrBfG3Jnb7nZQc1OEE3DhkrHuks5rGBn3gaJpZM4K4gwr>

Looks like this got fixed sometime between Jan 27 and Feb 10 2017.  In that timeperiod C# tests were not running for unrelated reason, so I am not sure what actually fixed it.
